Noble

Griffin Knight

Light infantry who fight with a bow. 
They can attack from a distance.

A dashing prince who rides a white 
horse into battle. Excels with a lance 
and serviceable with a blade.

One born into a noble royal family. 
A proficient horseman and skilled 
lancer.

Heavily armored axe-wielders clad 
in tough armor. They have high 
defense, but magic is their bane.

Proven warriors with an axe. Their 
swings are fierce, but leave them 
open to retaliation.

Axe-wielding knights who ride 
freely about the battlefield. They 
strike a good balance of skills.

Axe-wielders who soar through the 
sky on their pegasus mounts. Strong 
against magic, but weak to bows.

Fierce fighters with an insatiable 
rage. They possess great strength 
and speed, but little defense.

Mighty warriors of unparalleled 
strength. They cleave foes in twain 
with huge axes.

Bow users that fire from the saddle 
and outflank foes with high mobility.

Accomplished veterans proficient 
in several weapons and can easily 
cut through the front lines.

A charming bow knight who fights 
with casual flair. Skilled with both 
bow and sword, he toys with his foe.

A Sentinel who takes up arms to 
defend his nation. A proficient 
rider and archer.

Charming performers who can raise 
an ally's spirits, allowing the ally to 
act once more in battle.

Keeper of the power of the great 
reigning dragon. Uses Divine Dragon 
swords and martial arts.

Experienced knights who fly through 
the skies on wyverns. Though 
powerful, they fear bows and magic.

A descendant of a line of dragons 
going back to ancient days. Can use 
swords unique to the Divine Dragon.

Heroes from worlds beyond Elyos, 
who are contained in rings. They 
possess unimaginable power.

Magic-wielding swordswoman who 
can cut through enemy mages. She 
is also capable of wielding staves.

One born into a noble royal family. 
A proficient magic user who is also 
serviceable with a sword.

Heavily armored fighters boasting 
both an impenetrable defense and 
a fearsome offense.

Heavily armored knights clad in thick 
armor. They defend their allies with 
a variety of weapons.

Experienced knights who fly through 
the skies on a griffin. They are well- 
balanced and can use staves.

Lance-wielders with a great deal of 
battlefield experience. Several cuts 
above common lance fighters.

Masters of staves with wisdom 
from experience. Their healing 
powers are lifesaving in battle.

Heavily armored lancers clad in 
tough armor. They have high 
defense, but magic is their bane.

Soldiers who fight with a lance. They 
strike just the right balance between 
offense and defense.

Lance-wielding knights who ride 
freely about the battlefield. They 
strike a good balance of skills.

Lance users who soar through the 
sky on their pegasus mounts. Strong 
against magic, but weak to bows.

A magic-using wyvern rider who 
destroys enemies from above. Can 
use powerful magic and staves.

A knight who has a rapport with 
beasts. Rides a wyvern into battle 
and uses magic and staves.

Magic users who cast spells from 
tomes. Strong against enemies with 
high defense.

Magic knights who cast spells from 
horseback, but can also take part in 
melee combat.

Experienced monks trained in the 
martial arts. They excel at hand-to- 
hand combat as well as healing.

An alluring magic knight who rides 
an evil dragon. Overpowers with 
highly honed magic and sword skills.

Combat monks who use staves to 
heal wounded allies. They are versed 
in the martial arts of self-defense.

Minions of the Fell Dragon who aim 
to bring the world to ruin. Their dark 
breath destroys all.

High-ranking knights with a wealth 
of experience. Highly mobile and 
strong against magic.

Enormous draconic minions. Though 
they are slow, their breath can affect 
faraway enemies.

A lancer who pierces the enemy lines 
with flawless skill. Her bouncy steps 
presage deadly attacks.

A Sentinel who takes up arms to 
defend her nation. Proficient with 
the lance.

Noble knights who tear across the 
battlefield on horseback, rallying 
their allies. They can also use staves.

Experienced mages who can call 
upon great power. Capable of using 
both tomes and staves.

The Fell Dragon wielding the power 
of the Emblem Rings. Capable now 
of opening a gate to another world.

One who seeks to rule the world 
as a tyrant. Wields the dark arts to 
cause maximum destruction.

Mindless minion of the Fell Dragon. 
Uses powerful sword techniques.

Inheritor of the blood of the Fell 
Dragon. Excels in Fell skills and 
powerful dark magic.

A knight who rides the charming 
pegasus Sleipnir. Uses powerful 
staves and is skilled with tomes.

A knight who has a rapport with 
beasts. Rides a pegasus into battle 
and is skilled with tome and staff.

Masters of the bow who target their 
foes' weak points with precision 
strikes.

One with the will and strength to 
lead a nation. Skilled with both the 
blade and the axe.

One born into a family that leads 
a nation. Proficient with a sword.

Heavily armored sword fighters clad 
in tough armor. They have high 
defense, but magic is their bane.

Footsoldiers who take pride in their 
skill with a blade. They avoid enemy 
attacks with nimble footwork.

Sword-wielding knights who ride 
freely about the battlefield. They 
strike a good balance of skills.

Master sword fighters who avoid 
attacks by a hair's breadth and 
retaliate with mighty skills.

Sword fighters who soar through the 
sky on their pegasus mounts. Strong 
against magic, but weak to bows.

Burglars with a talent for picking 
locks. They are nimble with their 
hands and deadly with a knife.

An archer gifted with incredible 
aim. Each shot can eliminate a foe.

One born into a family that leads 
a nation. Proficient with a bow.

An ordinary person with no combat 
training.

Skilled experts in annihilating their 
enemies. They are capable with 
bows as well as axes.

Knights who dart over the battlefield 
mounted on wolves. Their knife 
strikes are the ruin of enemy camps.
